<[[https://www.honeywellaidc.com/pages/SiteLanguages.aspx]]> NEWS | Quarterly Helicopter Newsletter 2016 proved to be another difficult year as the headwinds which our industry faced in 2015 continued throughout the year. Looking at the past 24 months reflects an extremely challenging market with significant headwinds inhibiting industry growth. These headwinds can be summarized by: used aircraft up for sale at near all-time highs, lower flight utilization, depressed resale values, the decline in used aircraft appraisals, oil and gas bankruptcies in the US and Canada, a year over year decline in offshore rig counts and lastly, decreased OEM production levels, primarily in the medium and heavy-twin product classes. The outlook for 2017 reflects optimism as we anticipate industry stabilization; no more do we anticipate double-digit deltas in our leading indicators. New OEM deliveries indicate an improvement in certain product classes and equally as important, we do expect positive growth at the aggregate level. In the aftermarket, we are seeing positive signs which lead us to conclude that the tremendous decreases and/or increases in the leading indicators are behind us. A driving force in the aftermarket recovery is anchored around the need for differentiation as well as improved safety. Both of these anchors enable operators to be better positioned within their respective operating missions in both the short, and long term. Specific to improving safety, Honeywell continues to use fact-based analysis in identifying the top causes of accidents and incidents; this can be found in our article, Honeywell Technology Addresses 80% of Accident Causes. Honeywell’s heritage, culture and future will always focus on safety as we feel compelled to ensure the pilots, passengers, aircraft and ultimately our industry is safe. The first step in our journey to improving the rotorcraft industry safety record is through raising awareness and informing the operator base of the top causes of accidents and incidents, followed by advising the operator base that there are products and services available today which can help mitigate these causes. It is no coincidence that Honeywell has solutions to address 80% of the top causes of accidents and incidents. We encourage you to read this article and take this safety improvement journey with us. We sincerely hope your 2016 closes successfully with the anticipation that 2017 will be the year of stabilization.
Sincerely, Rick Angleo Director of Strategic Marketing: Global Commercial Helicopters
